wiki.content:
In 1988, after nine years of marriage to Pattie Boyd, Clapton divorced the model and photographer. This song documents the end of their relationship. Boyd told the Guardian newspaper December 13, 2008 that she was hurt that he should write a song about such a sensitive subject. She said: "The end of a relationship is a sad enough thing, but to then have Eric writing about it as well. It makes me more sad, I think, because I can't answer back."
        
User-contributed text is available under the Creative Commons By-SA License and may also be available under the GNU FDL.
wiki.summary: In 1988, after nine years of marriage to Pattie Boyd, Clapton divorced the model and photographer. This song documents the end of their relationship. Boyd told the Guardian newspaper December 13, 2008 that she was hurt that he should write a song about such a sensitive subject. She said: "The end of a relationship is a sad enough thing, but to then have Eric writing about it as well. It makes me more sad, I think, because I can't answer back."

track.name: Old Love
comments: I know this song has 2 hurt 4 Patty Boyd~
In my book this is second only to Layla in the Clapton playlist. Love the Live version from 24 Nights.
Heard the Unplugged version an hour ago and now the studio version. The former is THE version, but the song is still massive whether acoustic or electric.
This Unplugged version is just... absolutely incredible.
My grandmother told me one time when my grandfather died that there was nothing like "Old Love".  It's like a comfy pair of old shoes, you just slip right in.
the unplugged version is straight up UNBELIEVABLE, the album one is fine, but the unplugged one.....shivers every time.
There's a reason Eric Clapton's still popular after 50 years. He's great.Don't write songs like this anymore.
The unplugged version of this is so goddamn sexy.
♫ It's just an illusion caused by how I used to feel ♫ ... covers so many exes right there
за душу цепляет.

The version of this on Unplugged is one of Chuck Leavell's three favourite songs that he contributed to, according to Wikipedia. (The other two being "Jessica" by the Allman Brothers Band, and "Already Over Me" by the Rolling Stones.) Anyway, I looooove that version of it.
Amazing performance on Unplugged
Happy Early Birthday  ~~ ErIc ~~~
Check out Robert Cray's guitar (duet with EC on this track) on 'Phone Booth'
Rediscovered this song, and its excellent, excellent solos. It's like returning to Paradise.
Clapton is amazing
